# Test 2 Review Material {-}

Below are resources to help you practice and prepare for the test 2 in this course.

Test 2 will cover the material covered in Chapter 4 of this textbook:

- basic derivative rules
- product, quotient and chain rules
- implicit derivatives

What's not on this test:

- no interpretation style questions on this test
- no derivations 
- no limit definitions

## Test Instructions {-}
Below are the general instructions for all tests

- You will get a chance to **retake** this. Your **highest** score counts toward your final grade.  
- Follow the guidance for each part and **show all work** for full credit.  
- **Non-graphical calculators** are allowed.  
- **One page (two sides)** of handwritten (or font size 8) notes are allowed.
- The equation sheet from the textbook is included as part of the test pack (it doesn't count as note pages)

## Basic Rule Practice{-}

### 1. \(f(x)=7\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
The derivative of any constant is always \(0\).  
Think of a flat line — its slope never changes.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=0\)
</details>

---

### 2. \(f(x)=x^5\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the **power rule**: \((x^n)' = n x^{n-1}\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=5x^4\)
</details>

---

### 3. \(f(x)=3x^4\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
You have a constant multiplied by a power of \(x\).  
Apply the **constant multiple rule** with the **power rule**.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=12x^3\)
</details>

---

### 4. \(f(x)=5x^3-2x^2\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the **difference rule**: differentiate each term individually.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=15x^2-4x\)
</details>

---

### 5. \(f(x)=x^4+3x^2+5\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the **sum rule** and note that the derivative of a constant is zero.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=4x^3+6x\)
</details>

---

### 6. \(f(x)=9x^7-4x^3+2x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Each term loses one power when you apply the power rule.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=63x^6-12x^2+2\)
</details>

---

### 7. \(f(x)=\dfrac{1}{2}x^2-3x+4\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate each term.  
The first term is a parabola — its slope changes linearly with \(x\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=x-3\)
</details>

---

### 8. \(f(x)=10x^3+7x-12\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate each term using the power rule.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=30x^2+7\)
</details>

---

### 9. \(f(x)=x^6-9x^2+1\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Find \(f'(x)\) and simplify.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=6x^5-18x=6x(x^4-3)\)
</details>

---

### 10. \(f(x)=4x^3-12x^2+9x-1\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate each term; the derivative of a cubic is a quadratic.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=12x^2-24x+9\)
</details>

---

## Identity Rule Practice {-}

### 1. \(f(x)=e^x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the table entry for \(e^x\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=e^x\)
</details>

---

### 2. \(f(x)=3e^x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate \(e^x\) from the table, then scale by the constant.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=3e^x\)
</details>

---

### 3. \(f(x)=2e^{2x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(e^{g(x)}\) with \(g(x)=2x\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=4e^{2x}\)
</details>

---

### 4. \(f(x)=5e^{-x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(e^{g(x)}\) with \(g(x)=-x\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=-5e^{-x}\)
</details>

---

### 5. \(f(x)=e^{x^2}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(e^{g(x)}\) with \(g(x)=x^2\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=2x e^{x^2}\)
</details>

---

### 6. \(f(x)=e^{3x+1}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(e^{g(x)}\) with \(g(x)=3x+1\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=3e^{3x+1}\)
</details>

---

### 7. \(f(x)=10^x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the table entry for \(a^x\) with \(a=10\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=10^x \ln(10)\)
</details>

---

### 8. \(f(x)=2^{3x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(a^{g(x)}\) with \(a=2\), \(g(x)=3x\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=3\cdot 2^{3x}\ln 2\)
</details>

---

### 9. \(f(x)=5^x + 7^x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Apply the table entry for each exponential term separately.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=5^x\ln(5)+7^x\ln(7)\)
</details>

---

### 10. \(f(x)=3^x - 2^x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the \(a^x\) identity on each term.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=3^x\ln(3)-2^x\ln(2)\)
</details>

---

### 11. \(f(x)=\ln(x)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the table entry for \(\ln(x)\) (domain \(x>0\)).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{1}{x}\)
</details>

---

### 12. \(f(x)=\ln(3x)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(\ln(g(x))\) with \(g(x)=3x\) (domain \(x>0\)).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{1}{x}\)
</details>

---

### 13. \(f(x)=\ln(x^2+1)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(\ln(g(x))\) with \(g(x)=x^2+1\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{2x}{x^2+1}\)
</details>

---

### 14. \(f(x)=\ln(\sqrt{x})\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Write \(\sqrt{x}=x^{1/2}\), then use the \(\ln(x)\) identity (domain \(x>0\)).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{1}{2x}\)
</details>

---

### 15. \(f(x)=\log_2(x)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the table entry for \(\log_a(x)\) with \(a=2\) (domain \(x>0\)).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{1}{x\ln(2)}\)
</details>

---

### 16. \(f(x)=\log_3(2x)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(\log_a(g(x))\) with \(a=3\), \(g(x)=2x\) (domain \(x>0\)).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{1}{x\ln(3)}\)
</details>

---

### 17. \(f(x)=\ln(e^x+1)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(\ln(g(x))\) with \(g(x)=e^x+1\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{e^x}{e^x+1}\)
</details>

---

### 18. \(f(x)=e^{\ln(x)}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
First simplify using \(e^{\ln(x)}=x\) (domain \(x>0\)).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=1\)
</details>

---

### 19. \(f(x)=x e^x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate each factor using the table entries \(d(x)/dx=1\) and \(d(e^x)/dx=e^x\), then combine appropriately.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=e^x(1+x)\)
</details>

---

### 20. \(f(x)=\ln(x^3+x)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the identity for \(\ln(g(x))\) with \(g(x)=x^3+x\) (domain \(x>0\)).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{3x^2+1}{x^3+x}\)
</details>

---


## Basic Trig Derivative Practice{-}

### 1. \(f(x)=\sin x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use \((\sin x)'=\cos x\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\cos x\)
</details>

---

### 2. \(f(x)=\cos x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
\((\cos x)'=-\sin x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=-\sin x\)
</details>

---

### 3. \(f(x)=2\sin x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Multiply the derivative of \(\sin x\) by 2.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=2\cos x\)
</details>

---

### 4. \(f(x)=5\cos x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
\((\cos x)'=-\sin x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=-5\sin x\)
</details>

---

### 5. \(f(x)=\sin x+\cos x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate each term separately.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\cos x-\sin x\)
</details>

---

### 6. \(f(x)=3\sin x-4\cos x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use constant multiple and sum/difference rules.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=3\cos x+4\sin x\)
</details>

---

### 7. \(f(x)=\tan x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
\((\tan x)'=\sec^2 x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\sec^2 x\)
</details>

---

### 8. \(f(x)=\sec x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
\((\sec x)'=\sec x\tan x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\sec x\tan x\)
</details>

---

### 9. \(f(x)=\cot x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
\((\cot x)'=-\csc^2 x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=-\csc^2 x\)
</details>

---

### 10. \(f(x)=\csc x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
\((\csc x)'=-\csc x\cot x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=-\csc x\cot x\)
</details>

---

## Product Rule Practice{-}

### 1. \(f(x)=x\sin x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the product rule: \((uv)' = u'v + uv'\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\sin x + x\cos x\)
</details>

---

### 2. \(f(x)=x\cos x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
\((\cos x)'=-\sin x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\cos x - x\sin x\)
</details>

---

### 3. \(f(x)=x^2 e^x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Apply product rule: \(u=x^2, v=e^x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=2x e^x + x^2 e^x = e^x(x^2 + 2x)\)
</details>

---

### 4. \(f(x)=x^3\ln x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the product rule and derivative of \(\ln x\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=3x^2\ln x + x^2\)
</details>

---

### 5. \(f(x)=(x^2+1)\sin x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate both terms using product rule.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=2x\sin x + (x^2+1)\cos x\)
</details>

---

### 6. \(f(x)=x e^{2x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Product rule with \(v' = 2e^{2x}\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=e^{2x}(1+2x)\)
</details>

---

### 7. \(f(x)=x^2\cos x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Product rule: \(u=x^2, v=\cos x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=2x\cos x - x^2\sin x\)
</details>

---

### 8. \(f(x)=(3x-2)(x^2+4)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use product rule or expand first.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=9x^2-4x+12\)
</details>

---

### 9. \(f(x)=(x+1)e^x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use product rule and factor \(e^x\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=e^x(x+2)\)
</details>

---

### 10. \(f(x)=(2x-5)\tan x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use product rule: \(u=2x-5, v=\tan x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=2\tan x + (2x-5)\sec^2 x\)
</details>

---

## Quotient Rule Practice{-}

### 1. \(f(x)=\dfrac{1}{x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Rewrite as \(x^{-1}\) or use the quotient rule.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=-\dfrac{1}{x^2}\)
</details>

---

### 2. \(f(x)=\dfrac{x}{x^2+1}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use \((u/v)'=\dfrac{u'v-uv'}{v^2}\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{1-x^2}{(x^2+1)^2}\)
</details>

---

### 3. \(f(x)=\dfrac{x^2}{x+1}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Apply quotient rule and simplify.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{x^2+2x}{(x+1)^2}\)
</details>

---

### 4. \(f(x)=\dfrac{x^2+1}{x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Simplify after differentiating.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=1-\dfrac{1}{x^2}\)
</details>

---

### 5. \(f(x)=\dfrac{\sin x}{x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use quotient rule: \(u=\sin x, v=x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{x\cos x-\sin x}{x^2}\)
</details>

---

### 6. \(f(x)=\dfrac{x}{\sin x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate and simplify.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{\sin x - x\cos x}{\sin^2 x}\)
</details>

---

### 7. \(f(x)=\dfrac{e^x}{x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Combine exponential and quotient rules.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{e^x(x-1)}{x^2}\)
</details>

---

### 8. \(f(x)=\dfrac{\ln x}{x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use quotient rule: \(u=\ln x, v=x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{1-\ln x}{x^2}\)
</details>

---

### 9. \(f(x)=\dfrac{x^2}{e^x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate numerator and denominator.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{2x-x^2}{e^x}\)
</details>

---

### 10. \(f(x)=\dfrac{\tan x}{x^2}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use quotient rule and simplify.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{x\sec^2 x - 2\tan x}{x^3}\)
</details>

---

## Chain Rule Practice{-}

### 1. \(f(x)=\sin(2x)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Outer: \(\sin(u)\), Inner: \(u=2x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=2\cos(2x)\)
</details>

---

### 2. \(f(x)=\cos(3x)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Outer: \(\cos(u)\), Inner: \(u=3x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=-3\sin(3x)\)
</details>

---

### 3. \(f(x)=e^{5x}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use \( (e^{g(x)})' = g'(x)e^{g(x)} \)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=5e^{5x}\)
</details>

---

### 4. \(f(x)=\ln(4x+1)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use chain rule for \(\ln(g(x))\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{4}{4x+1}\)
</details>

---

### 5. \(f(x)=\sqrt{3x+2}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
\(\sqrt{3x+2}=(3x+2)^{1/2}\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=\dfrac{3}{2\sqrt{3x+2}}\)
</details>

---

### 6. \(f(x)=(2x+1)^5\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use \((g(x))^n)'=n(g(x))^{n-1}g'(x)\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=10(2x+1)^4\)
</details>

---

### 7. \(f(x)=\tan(4x)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Outer: \(\tan(u)\), Inner: \(u=4x\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=4\sec^2(4x)\)
</details>

---

### 8. \(f(x)=\sin(x^2)\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Outer: \(\sin(u)\), Inner: \(u=x^2\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=2x\cos(x^2)\)
</details>

---

### 9. \(f(x)=e^{x^2+1}\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate exponent using chain rule.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=2x e^{x^2+1}\)
</details>

---

### 10. \(f(x)=\cos(\sqrt{x})\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Outer: \(\cos(u)\); Inner: \(u=\sqrt{x}\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(f'(x)=-\dfrac{\sin(\sqrt{x})}{2\sqrt{x}}\)
</details>

---

## Implicit Derivative Practice{-}

### 1. \(x^2 + y^2 = 25\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate both sides with respect to \(x\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx} = -\dfrac{x}{y}\)
</details>

---

### 2. \(x^3 + y^3 = 9xy\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use the product rule on \(9xy\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{9y - 3x^2}{3y^2 - 9x}\)
</details>

---

### 3. \(x^2y + xy^2 = 6\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Apply product rule to both terms.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx} = -\dfrac{2xy + y^2}{x^2 + 2xy}\)
</details>

---

### 4. \(\sin y = x^2 + y\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate \(\sin y\) using chain rule.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{2x}{\cos y - 1}\)
</details>

---

### 5. \(e^y = x^2y + 3\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate each term, use product rule for \(x^2y\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{2xy}{e^y - x^2}\)
</details>

---

### 6. \(\tan y = x\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate \(\tan y\) with chain rule.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=\cos^2 y\)
</details>

---

### 7. \(x^2 + xy + y^2 = 7\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Use product rule on \(xy\) and chain rule on \(y^2\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx} = -\dfrac{2x + y}{x + 2y}\)
</details>

---

### 8. \(x^2 = \sin y\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Differentiate both sides.
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=\dfrac{2x}{\cos y}\)
</details>

---

### 9. \(x^2y^2 = 16\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Product rule: \(u=x^2, v=y^2\)
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx} = -\dfrac{y}{x}\)
</details>

---

### 10. \(x^2 + \cos y = 4\){-}

<details>
<summary><strong>Math Hint</strong></summary>
Derivative of \(\cos y\) is \(-\sin y\dfrac{dy}{dx}\).
</details>

<details>
<summary><strong>Solution</strong></summary>
\(\dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{2x}{\sin y}\)
</details>
